acceptance: The demo log confirms that under burst load, safety-class event records are not lost and the reserve-capacity requirement is maintained.
assumptions: The logging buffer uses fixed memory capacity and a ring-buffer eviction strategy.
conditions: The demo repository is loaded locally; operations are executed through the CookaReq CLI.
notes: Derived LLR without upward traceability: this refinement was introduced after stress tests of the demo bench.
rationale: Rationale: this requirement emerged from logger load-testing results and protects the diagnostic value of logs under peak load. No direct SYS/HLR linkage is recorded because it formalizes an internal buffering policy.
statement: The AUDIT_BUFFER subsystem shall reserve at least 30% of ring-buffer capacity for safety-critical events and prevent their eviction by info/debug events.
title: LLR-08 Buffer reservation for safety events
